abstract: Michiko Kakutani reviews books Charles Dickens by Claire Tomalin and Becoming Dickens: The Invention of a Novelist by Robert Douglas-Fairhurst.
snippet: Claire Tomalin’s “Charles Dickens” and Robert Douglas-Fairhurst’s “Becoming Dickens” explore a complicated author.
lead_paragraph: Claire Tomalin’s “Charles Dickens” and Robert Douglas-Fairhurst’s “Becoming Dickens” explore a complicated author.

headline.main: Two-Sided Man Gets Two New Biographies
headline.print_headline: Two-Sided Man Gets Two New Biographies
headline.seo: ‘Charles Dickens,’ by Claire Tomalin; ‘Becoming Dickens’ by Robert Douglas-Fairhurst
